alert.note: Alert for Coos (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 15 at 12:50PM PST until January 17 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Medford OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille affecting Coos County. For the Coquille River...including Coquille...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Coquille River at Coquille. * WHEN...From about 5 pm this afternoon to Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, The Coquille River is at flood stage. Expect flooding of farmland and low-lying areas throughout the flood plain along the Coquille River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM PST Sunday the stage was 20.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 21.9 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm PST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Coquille River Coquille 21.0 20.2 Sun 11 am PS 21.8 19.1 17.1 &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM PST.
